Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
The solution is a little unfair... but unless under attack the notaries would still get paid the average they are owed. 
What I had to do was, calcualte the amount they are paid from 2 notarizations ago, so that the amount owed is from a state of chain that is itself notarized. That way a continious reorging of the chain, will simply stop notarisations all together until the attack stops, and once it stops normal operations will resume without forking the chain, creating the situation in LABSTRE where the chain contains an invalid block on sync. 

It was still possible for miners to include 2 notarizations in a block under a very very special case. I think that is now fixed. But this does mean that 3 notarizations have to happen BEFORE anyone can be paid. This will remove the "bonus for notarizing first" üò¶

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: What notarization data are you using?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
I modified the Komodo State structure then spent about 3H getting it to update on deamon load and when adding a checkpoint to insert a new integer with the previous notarized height, and the one previous to that again. 
This way, to calcualte how much to pay out, its using not the current notarisation, which can be reorged outof the chain, but the previous one which has been notarized itself (or at least it should have been, in any real world application)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The issue only comes, when syncing the chain, there can be an invalid block , becase a node that isnt onlone to see the reorg cant see the previous notarization in the chain as usually its confirmed 1 tx later... I also made this so it cannot under any circumstance have more than one notarisation in a block... which in and of itself will stop the DOS 99% of the time anyway.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: When not under attack, the chain will never fork or fail ... when under attack notarizations wont really happen... and ntoaries wont really get paid...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But who is going to 100% attack a PoS/PoW chain just to make notaries not get paid? Seems unlikely.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not to mention extremly hard to carry out.
